metadata.title: Intelligent Textbook Architecture
metadata.description: How the tools work together to build and publish an intelligent textbook

nodes.label:
You
(the Author)
nodes.description: You are the author and subject matter expert. You write content, review output, and guide the AI assistant.

nodes.label:
VS Code
(Your Desk)
nodes.description: VS Code is your workspace where you see all files, edit Markdown chapters, and organize the project. It has a file explorer, editor, and integrated terminal.

nodes.label:
Claude Code
(AI Helper)
nodes.description: Claude Code is your AI writing assistant. It reads, writes, and organizes files, runs commands, searches the project, and remembers context between conversations.

nodes.label:
MkDocs
(Book Maker)
nodes.description: MkDocs takes your Markdown files and bakes them into a beautiful website with navigation, search, and formatting. Commands: mkdocs serve, mkdocs build, mkdocs gh-deploy.

nodes.label:
GitHub
(Cloud Locker)
nodes.description: GitHub stores your project safely in the cloud, keeps a history of every change, and hosts the finished website for free via GitHub Pages.

nodes.label:
Readers
(The World)
nodes.description: Anyone in the world can read the published textbook at dmccreary.github.io/fluid-power-systems. The site is free and always available.
